sberry.BLL

Class BLL

  • java.lang.Object
    • sberry.BLL.BLL

  • public class BLL
extends java.lang.Object
    The business logic layer, or BLL, class here is concerned with how the data is retrieved and stored in the database
    Author:
    Fouad Abou Harfouche

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BLL() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addtodb(sberry.SDK.User user)
      This method is used to insert the survey, the survey questions and the survey permission into the database
      static java.lang.String getnewEmail()
      Getter for email, used to update email in case the initial input was wrong
      static java.lang.String getnewPass()
      Getter for password used to update password in case the initial input was wrong
      static void linkgenerator(sberry.SDK.User user)
      This method is used locally to generate a link for the survey, which is then copied to the clipboard
      static boolean verify(java.lang.String mail, java.lang.String pass)
      This method takes email and password as parameters and checks to see if they are in the database, returning a boolean indicating if they are or not
      static boolean verifyfail(java.lang.String useremail, java.lang.String userpass, boolean a)
      This recursive method runs if the initial inputed email and password are not in the database, it checks to see if the user would like to re-input, if yes then it takes a new email and password form the user until the inputed email and password are found in the database or until the user chooses to not to re-input

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public BLL()

    • Method Detail

      • verifyfail

        public static boolean verifyfail(java.lang.String useremail,
                                 java.lang.String userpass,
                                 boolean a)
                          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                 java.sql.SQLException
        This recursive method runs if the initial inputed email and password are not in the database, it checks to see if the user would like to re-input, if yes then it takes a new email and password form the user until the inputed email and password are found in the database or until the user chooses to not to re-input
        Parameters:
        useremail - user's email address
        userpass - user's password
        a - boolean true if email and pass are correct, false otherwise
        Returns:
        boolean true if email and pass are correct, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getnewEmail

        public static java.lang.String getnewEmail()
        Getter for email, used to update email in case the initial input was wrong
        Returns:
        email

      • getnewPass

        public static java.lang.String getnewPass()
        Getter for password used to update password in case the initial input was wrong
        Returns:
        pass

      • verify

        public static boolean verify(java.lang.String mail,
                             java.lang.String pass)
                      throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                             java.sql.SQLException
        This method takes email and password as parameters and checks to see if they are in the database, returning a boolean indicating if they are or not
        Parameters:
        mail - user's email
        pass - user's password
        Returns:
        boolean verify, true if email and pass are in the database, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • linkgenerator

        public static void linkgenerator(sberry.SDK.User user)
        This method is used locally to generate a link for the survey, which is then copied to the clipboard
        Parameters:
        user - user object

      • addtodb

        public static void addtodb(sberry.SDK.User user)
        This method is used to insert the survey, the survey questions and the survey permission into the database
        Parameters:
        user - user object
